text: The 1961 Winnipeg Blue Bombers finished in 1st place in the Western Conference with a 13–3 record. The Blue Bombers defeated the Hamilton Tiger-Cats to win the 49th Grey Cup. ==Preseason== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! style="background:#0d254c;color:#c9b074;" width="5%"| Week ! style="background:#0d254c;color:#c9b074;" width="8%"| Date ! style="background:#0d254c;color:#c9b074;" width="20%"| Opponent ! style="background:#0d254c;color:#c9b074;" width="10%"| Score ! style="background:#0d254c;color:#c9b074;" width="10%"| Result ! style="background:#0d254c;color:#c9b074;" width="10%"| Record |-align="center" bgcolor="#ffbbbb" | A | July 20 | at Ottawa Rough Riders | 28–15 | Loss | 0–1 |-align="center" bgcolor="#ddffdd" | B | July 27 | vs. Toronto Argonauts | 20–18 | Win | 1–1 |} ==Regular season== ===Standings=== {| class="wikitable" |+ Western Football Conference !
